page.title: 01Rural Life To_day
page.content: Rural life is in the 1980's very transient as people move around a great deal possibly as a result of their occupations.Farming methods having changed very rapidly in the last 25 years, labour intensified and limited.People generally have their own transport, averaging two cars per family, both parents going out to work possibly commuting to London or more locally to cities such as Winchester or Salisbury. Children travel in coaches to school as much as 15_20 miles to the secondary education schools.Many houses are second homes to the affluent of soceity,who travel down at week_ends to enjoy the peace of the countryside and their gardens.Alas they contribute nothing to village life.It can be arguedthat they have rescued derelict farm cottages.
